document.docAuthor: Serrano, Artur R. M., Capela, Rúben A., Nunes, Telmo & Santos, Carmen Van-Dú- Nem Neto
document.masterDocTitle: The rose chafers (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Cetoniinae) of Angola: a descriptive checklist with new records and synonymic notes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The rose chafers (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae: Cetoniinae) of Angola: a descriptive checklist with new records and synonymic notes

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution : ANG, BOW, MAW, MOZ, NAB, RSA , TAN, ZAM, ZIM.

Distribution in Angola (Provinces):
1) CCU , HUI , LNO , MAL; 2) BIE , CUS , HUA , LSU , MOX.

Material examined: Angola , 5 exs, Nº 1907 (blue labels), old collection, box nº XIV-83, MZUC;
Angola , 1 ex. , Nº 1907 (blue label), nº 22 (white label), old collection, box VI-75, MZUC

Remarks. Despite the species be known for Angola since a long time ago ( e.g. Bourgoin 1925 ), both Beinhundner (2017a) and Schoolmeesters (2018) do not consider its presence in that country. All the examined specimens fit the mesotibial character (only one tooth on the external margin) proper of this species ( Rigout & Allard 1992 ). The adult specimens from Chianga were collected on bean plants (label information). The Mussende adult specimen was sampled by BT in a secondary moist forest together with
Lophorrhina quinquelineata (Fabricius, 1791)
,
Tmesorrhina laeta burgeoni Allard, 1991
and
Myodermum alutaceum (Afzelius, 1817)
. The larva of this species was described by Oberholzer (1959) . Ecological data were provided by Holm & Marais (1992) , but see Malec & Šípek (2016) for breeding habits also. It is a new record for the Bié , Huambo , Kwanza Sul , Lunda Sul and Moxico Provinces.
